author: @Cleveland19
title: Chagrin Falls year-end celebration expected to be ‘poppin’
text: Chagrin Falls year-end celebration expected to be ‘poppin’ CHAGRIN FALLS, Ohio (WOIO) - Several local towns are set to do their year-end celebrations, including Chagrin Falls. Dozens of people will gather at Triangle Park to see the show New Year’s Eve. It’s a great way to “pop” into the New Year. “We raise up a giant popcorn ball the day before New Year’s eve. At the countdown to midnight, we lower the popcorn ball like they do in Times Square and that’s our small town version of a big town thing,” said the General Manager Rachal Raymond. The popcorn ball is known as Jupiter. He sits outside of the Chagrin Falls Popcorn Shop on Main Street. Employees and community members work to make sure Jupiter looks good every year. “Last year after it was done and retired for the season. It got a little funky so we had to give it a facelift. We took the outer layer off and we re-mushed the popcorn to it,” said Raymond. The Chagrin Falls tradition continues to get bigger and better. “When we first started, we had a few people with cone hats on AKA popcorn in the shape of a cone hat. A few years in we had maybe a few hundred people. Last year we had about 1500 people in town. They had streets closed off. There was literal dancing in the street. We had a Dj. It was so cool,” said Raymond. There will be music, lights and dancing this upcoming Sunday. “The community love around here is very real. Because it is such a small town. Kind of tucked away in the middle of nowhere it feel like a hallmark movie,” said Raymond. People will meet up at the Town Hall for hot cocoa and cookies at 10:30 p.m. Everyone will walk down to Triangle Park for the popcorn ball launch and dancing. Copyright 2023 WOIO. All rights reserved.

author: Variety
title: Alberta country artist travels to Oklahoma to sing for Zach Bryan
text:
CBC Alberta country artist travels to Oklahoma to sing for Zach Bryan Read full article CBC December 28, 2023 at 11:52 p.m. · 2 min read Left, Zach Bryan photographs the musicians during a sound check. Right, a still shot of Noeline Hofmann from a teaser video posted by Bryan. (Nicholas Hofmann/Louie Nice - image credit)
An Alberta musician recently had the chance to work with country musician Zach Bryan — and will soon be featured in one of his videos.
Noeline Hofmann, 20, a country artist from Bow Island, Alta., performed her song Purple Gas for Bryan, which he recorded as part of his The Belting Bronco series.
LISTEN | A musician from Bow Island just worked with Zach Bryan, one of the biggest names in country music right now:
"[The song] was inspired by tax-deducted fuel that we have for farmers here in Alberta," Hofmann said on the Calgary Eyeopener .
"I was working a ranch job. I got home in October of last year, and I was thinking about that and the effect that experience had on me, and ... the resilient, rural people that that brought me up."
Prior to filming, she posted a snippet of the song on her Tiktok, which went viral and caught Bryan's attention.
Bryan's song Something in Orange was in the top five of Canada's most streamed songs in 2023.
From left to right: Noeline Hofmann, Jamie Hamburg, Lucas Ruge-Jones, Louie Nice, and Zephyr Avalon during filming. From left to right: Noeline Hofmann, Jamie Hamburg, Lucas Ruge-Jones, Louie Nice, and Zephyr Avalon during filming. (Noeline Hofmann)
The Belting Bronco is a series that Bryan does highlighting musicians who perform in the back seat of his Bronco in Oklahoma.
Hofmann said her song will be the series' episode seven.
"It was a surreal — definitely surreal — experience. I never, never thought in my wildest dreams that that would happen this year, if ever. But it was great. We had a lot of fun," she said.
On Instagram, Bryan announced that The Belting Bronco was coming back — and would be kicking off with Hofmann.
"It was such an honour hearing her sing and getting to record this beautiful song," he wrote.
Hofmann said since Bryan posted about the upcoming video she's seen a lot of new interest in her and her music, and she's working on new recordings which will be released next year.
TRENDING 1. A broken pelvis, a severed vein and a holiday ruined 2. B.C. trucker found dead 4 days after completing delivery in Winnipeg, family friend says 3. Alberta family of three reported missing on Christmas found dead: RCMP 4. Nikki Haley doesn't mention slavery when asked what caused the Civil War. She later walks that back 5. North Korea's Kim orders military to accelerate war preparations -state media
